definition[0]: a group of people who come to watch and listen to someone speaking or performing in public
example[0]: The audience began clapping and cheering.
example[1]: One member of the audience described the opera as ‘boring’.
definition[1]: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work
note[1]: target audience (=the type of people that a programme, advertisement etc is supposed to attract)
example[3]: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
example[4]: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
example[5]: The book is not intended for a purely academic audience.
definition[2]: a formal meeting with a very important person
example[6]: He was granted an audience with the Pope.

definition[3]: the number or kind of people who watch or listen to something that is broadcast on radio or television, or listen to a particular type of music
example[29]: The ad was broadcast on all major channels, giving it an audience of millions.
